choices.B: FortiGate creates a single IPsec virtual interface that is shared by all clients.
choices.A: FortiGate creates separate virtual interfaces for each dial-up client.
choices.C: FortiGate maps the remote gateway 100.64.3.1 to tunnel index interface 1.
choices.D: FortiGate does not install IPsec static routes for remote protected networks in the routing table.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
BC refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 184
BC are correct
Ans is BC

I think correct answer is B,C
If net-device is disabled, FortiGate creates a single IPSEC virtual interface that is shared by all IPSEC clients connecting to the same dialup VPN. In this case, the tunnel-search setting determines how FortiGate learns the network behind each remote client.
Could this be C? port1=sla_map 0x0 and port 2=sla_map 0x1
Ans is D

Selected Answer: D
D refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 57
Agree correct answer is D

choices.D: The SLA state of port1 is dead after five unanswered requests by the SLA servers.
choices.A: Port1 became dead because no traffic was offload through the egress of port1.
choices.B: SD-WAN member interfaces are affected by the SLA state of the inactive interface.
choices.C: Both SD-WAN member interfaces have used separate SLA targets.
The number of simultaneous connections allowed for each source IP address can exceed 5 connections.
choices.A: The traffic shaper limits the bandwidth of each source IP address to a maximum of 625 KB/sec.
choices.D: The traffic shaper limits the combined bandwidth of all connections to a maximum of 5 MB/sec.
choices.B: The number of simultaneous connections among all source IP addresses can exceed 5 connections.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
A: per ip = max bandwith is set per client 
B: per ip = max session per client is 5 so if we have multiple client, the total can be more than 5

B would be the best option here as combined, the total number of concurrent connections across all IP's can exceed 5. The limit is 5 PER IP.

questions.question_text: Which two benefits from using forward error correction (FEC) in IPsec VPNs are true? (Choose two.)

choices.C: FEC transmits additional packets as redundant data to the remote device.
choices.B: FEC reduces the stress on the remote device buffer to reconstruct packet loss.
choices.A: FEC transmits the original payload in full to recover the error in transmission.
choices.D: FEC improves reliability, which overcomes adverse WAN conditions such as noisy links.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
C & D are the correct answers

Selected Answer: CD
CD refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 191
C,D is correct.
Correct ans CD
C and D are correct. Packet duplication would apply to A.
I think correct answer is C,D
